New Records: Oklahoma City Thunder set a franchise-record 13th consecutive regular-season win
Key Match Events: Thunder trailed by 16 in the first half before pulling within 52-48 at halftime
Thunder exploded for 42 third-quarter points and an 18-point lead heading into the fourth quarter
Jalen Williams hit a runner at the halftime buzzer to cut the Clippers lead to four, then scored the first six points of the second half to jumpstart a 23-5 run that put the Thunder in control
Pre-Game Insights: Clippers were without James Harden, a late scratch
Kawhi Leonard expected to return for the Clippers on Saturday
Post-Match Reflections: Shai Gilgeous-Alexander expressed his team's depth overwhelmed the Clippers despite the slow start
Thunder's coach highlighted the win as a crucial step in their journey
Miscellaneous Highlights: Thunder wound up at an even 50 per cent for the game and added to their league-leading steal total with 11 takeaways
Norman Powell missed his first nine shots and didn't get a basket until eight minutes remained, finishing with six points on 1-of-11 shooting including 0-for-5 from three-point range
Others: Thunder continue their homestand Friday night against the Knicks
Clippers return home to host Atlanta on Saturday
